headline.main: NEWS FROM ALBANY.; Probable Defeat of the Broadway Railroad Bill The Bill to Define the Crime of Murder The Marital Relations The Select Committee on the Health Bill The Harbor-Masters Passage of the Annual Appropriation Bill, & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House only held a session last evening. The special orders were suspended for a few minutes, and various motions and resolutions were introduced, mostly to move forward bills for consideration as "special orders." Mr. MOLEOD, by unanimous consent, introduced a bill appropriating $10,000 to the Woman's Industrial Farm Association. The bill to incorporate the Mechanics' Blind Association of NewYork City, was made the special order for next Thursday.

headline.main: NEWS FROM ALBANY.; Statesmanlike Coarse of the Majority of the City Delegation--Fillibustering Against Business--The Quarantine Grounds--Dr. Brown's Opinion of Homoeopathy, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Although the House did not adjourn on Saturday until this evening, they might have us well done so, for the hegira of members to their homes was just about as great as usual, and the House was able to accomplish nothing, except to receive a few reports from the Committees, and to adjourn before 1 o'clock for lack of something to do which so small a quorum could safely undertake.

docs.abstract: Comment on merits of Turkish bath about to be established in NYC
docs.lead_paragraph: It is somewhat mortifying in this age of the world for a Christian to be forced to take lessons of a Turk in the matter of "cleanliness, which is next to Godliness," but as John Bull, who seldom patterns after anybody but himself, has condescended to introduce the Turkish bath into his dominions, and suffers himself to be scrubbed by a Tellak, while he extols the manipulation, it certainly cannot be amiss in...
